events.title: People and Parliament – 75 Years Living Democracy
events.short_description: Free 30-minute film and laser projection show celebrating 75 years of German democracy at the Bundestag's Marie-Elisabeth-Lüders-Haus
events.description: Part of the Festival of Democracy, this nightly AV installation combines film, music, narration and laser projections to tell the story of Germany's parliament. Runs July 6–Oct 3; admission is free.

events.title: Vincent: Between Madness and Wonder – Immersive Van Gogh
events.short_description: Immersive 360° exhibition brings Vincent van Gogh's paintings to life through projections, sound and scent.
events.description: This 75‑minute multi‑sensory installation uses floor‑to‑ceiling projections, surround sound and interactive elements to explore van Gogh's art and life. Runs daily Sept 26 2025 – Jan 11 2026.

events.title: AI to Touch – Interactive AI Exhibition
events.short_description: Hands-on AI exhibition with stations for face recognition, robotics, mixed reality and speech‑to‑text.
events.description: At the German Museum of Technology's new AI Centre, visitors play with interactive stations showing how AI supports medicine, robotics, mixed reality and more. Exhibition runs Sept 28 – Dec 30; free entry.

events.title: Myth and Modernity – Sanctuary of Asclepios VR
events.short_description: 360° VR exhibition transports visitors to the ancient healing sanctuary of Kos.
events.description: Experience the ancient sanctuary of Asclepios on Kos as a 360° virtual reality journey that recreates festival atmosphere and healing rituals. Open Thu–Sun 14–17 until Oct 5; admission free.

events.title: Emixar II: Transformative Senses
events.short_description: Multi-sensory XR exhibition combining real art with extended reality to engage all five senses.
events.description: Visitors wear XR glasses to explore artworks that integrate haptic feedback, scents, soundscapes and performative elements. Emixar II runs Sept 10 – Dec 18, Thu–Sun 12:00–21:00. Regular tickets 19.90 €.

events.title: Machu Picchu: Journey to the Lost City VR
events.short_description: Step into Machu Picchu through a 45‑minute VR expedition with 360° visuals and historical narration.
events.description: Using cutting‑edge virtual reality headsets, this immersive journey recreates the Incan citadel of Machu Picchu with panoramic visuals, sound and storytelling. Open daily Sept 11 – Dec 31; tickets from 20 €.

events.title: Naruto The Gallery – Immersive Exhibition
events.short_description: Immersive anime exhibition with seven themed galleries exploring Naruto's story, friendship and identity.
events.description: Celebrate the European premiere of Naruto The Gallery with seven curated installations that use projections and contemporary art to revisit iconic scenes from the series. Runs Aug 27 – Nov 24; admission 26 €.

events.title: 3hd Festival – Heavy Rotation Opening
events.short_description: Opening event of 3hd Festival with a group exhibition and performance exploring the tension of Heavy Rotation.
events.description: The 3hd festival kicks off with Heavy Rotation at Haus der Visionäre, a conceptual exhibition examining motion and gravity and featuring an opening performance by Joshua Woolford w/ Sippin' T & Lie Ning. 18:00–00:00.

events.title: 3hd Festival – Nausea
events.short_description: Live performance event at 3hd Festival exploring existential themes through dance, sound and audiovisual art.
events.description: Nausea channels Sartrean confrontation with the absurd through performances by caner teker, Kinlaw, Sippin' T and Zein Majali, transforming existential crisis into creative reconstruction. 20:00–00:00.

events.title: 3hd Festival – Shifting Ground
events.short_description: 3hd performance program featuring Lewis Walker's Bornsick and Johanna Hedva's new work Fist at HAU.
events.description: Shifting Ground pairs Lewis Walker's gymnastics‑driven exploration of inherited identities in Bornsick with Johanna Hedva's haunting songs from Fist, co-directed by George R. Miller. The evening examines how unstable terrains reshape selfhood.
